intro: Senecio nigrocinctus, commonly known as the black-belt senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are dark green with a distinctive black or purple band near the base, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
